item.question: A company offered its 350 employees a bonus of Rs 10 to each male and Rs 8.15 to each female. All the females accepted but a certain percentage of males refused to accept. The total bonus paid was independent of the number of males. What was the total amount paid to the females (in rupees)?

Ram bought ‘a’ flowers for ‘b’ rupees, where ‘a’ and ‘b’ are integers. If he had bought 10 more flowers he would have got all for Rs. 2 and saved 80 paisa a dozen. What are the respective vales of ‘a’ and ‘b’?
The integers 49966 and 52231 when divided by a three digit number ‘n’ give the same remainder. What is the value of n?
The HCF of two numbers is 21 and their LCM is 4641. If one of the numbers is between 200 and 300, find the other number.
What is the least number of digits in the number formed from only zeroes and ones such that the number is divisible by 225?
A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
A and B invest in a business in the ratio 3 : 2. If 5% of the total profit goes to charity and A's share is Rs. 855, the total profit is:
A batsman scored 110 runs which included 3 boundaries and 8 sixes. What percent of his total score did he make by running between the wickets?

The ratio between the length and the breadth of a rectangular park is 3 : 2. If a man cycling along the boundary of the park at the speed of 12 km/hr completes one round in 8 minutes, then the area of the park (in sq. m) is:

Three pipes A, B and C can fill a tank from empty to full in 30 minutes, 20 minutes, and 10 minutes respectively. When the tank is empty, all the three pipes are opened. A, B and C discharge chemical solutions P,Q and R respectively. What is the proportion of the solution R in the liquid in the tank after 3 minutes?
